resources.name: Liberty Park
resources.description: Massive city park with shady walking paths, two playgrounds, splash pad, aviary, pond, sports, and open green space.
reviews: This park is huge, family and pet friendly. The playgrounds are very nice and well maintained.
The aviary is incredible, and my kids love the splash pad.
A must-visit spot in SLC for anyone with kids.
Great place for jogging, walking your dog, picnics, or just relaxing.

resources.name: Rosewood Park
resources.description: Neighborhood park known for its large grassy fields, updated playground, and safe, quiet vibe.
reviews: Such a beautifully maintained neighborhood park with a great playground.
Quiet, clean, and fun for the kids.
Tons of grass and space for kids to run and play.
Nice walking path with lots of shade.

resources.name: Rotary Glen Park
resources.description: Park with wooded areas, river, picnic sites, and a small but fun play area.
reviews: Pretty park with a playground and a pond. Great for little kids.
A hidden gem—peaceful and perfect for picnics.
Nice open spaces and a fun play area.

resources.name: Great Salt Lake State Park
resources.description: State park by the lakeshore, offers water views, boat marina, picnicking, casual wading, and birdwatching.
reviews: Beautiful views! The kids like watching the boats and skipping rocks.
Nice place for a sunset walk with the family.
Interesting to see the salt flats and wade in the water.

resources.name: East Riverfront Park
resources.description: Trail-adjacent, riverside park with big lawns, creative playground, and picnic space.
reviews: It’s clean, quiet, and has a nice play area for children.
I love walking along the river with my kids here.
The playground is great, and there's a picnic area too.

resources.name: Murray Park
resources.description: Classic city park: large, shady, with multiple playgrounds, sports fields, picnic spaces, and a stream for exploration.
reviews: Lots of playgrounds and room to run. Super family-friendly.
Perfect shady park for summer.
My kids love the creek!
Great for big gatherings and events.

resources.name: Sugar House Park
resources.description: Sprawling historic park with walking trails, climbing equipment, sledding hills in winter, and scenic lake.
reviews: Massive park, we always come for walks and picnics.
Great sledding hills in the winter.
Fun playground and beautiful scenery.

resources.name: Mountview Park
resources.description: Splash pad, well-designed playground with safe surfaces, lots of shade, and sports court.
reviews: Wonderful splash pad and playground. Lots of shade and seating.
My toddlers could play here for hours.
Always clean and safe.

resources.name: Memory Grove Park
resources.description: Wooded trails, creek, bridges, memorial gardens. Great for relaxed walks and nature discovery.
reviews: One of the most peaceful places in Salt Lake City.
Nice trails and creek access.
Quiet spot to walk and let the kids enjoy nature.

resources.name: Union Park
resources.description: Relaxed, mature park with open play space, traditional playground, mature shade trees, and tennis courts.
reviews: Great little park. Perfect for young kids.
Love the big grassy areas and old trees.
Great for jogging and walking the dog too.

resources.name: Wardle Fields Regional Park
resources.description: Gigantic kids’ destination: innovative playgrounds, two ziplines, splash pad, picnic/BBQ, and climbing walls.
reviews: Amazing playground with unique structures and zipline.
The splash pad is always a hit with my kids.
Very busy in summer but so worth it.
Well maintained and lots to do.

resources.name: Oquirrh Shadows Park
resources.description: Neighborhood park known for updated play equipment, lawns, shaded picnic spots, and sports fields.
reviews: Nice big playground, and it’s always clean.
Lots of space for kids to play.
Safe and well-kept, our favorite neighborhood park.

resources.name: Wheadon Farm Park
resources.description: Open lawns, walking paths, modern “farm style” playground with tractor features, courtyard.
reviews: My kids love the tractor and farm-themed playground.
Great open space and safe play area.
Perfect for younger children.

resources.name: Riverton City Park
resources.description: Multi-zone family park: several playgrounds, large splash pad, picnic shelters, event venue, sports fields.
reviews: Lots of playground options and a fun splash pad.
Big park with plenty of open field.
Our go-to spot for family outings.

resources.name: Olympus Hills Park
resources.description: Elevated park with unique climbing features and panoramic views. Perfect for casual play and sunset picnics.
reviews: Unique climbing areas for kids, beautiful views.
Best park for sunsets and picnics.
Great for family photos.

resources.name: Hidden Valley Park
resources.description: Quiet, open neighborhood park with big play structure, mountain views, and lots of grass for running.
reviews: Large and quiet—plenty of space for kids to run.
Nice play structure and big grassy area.
We love to picnic here.

resources.name: South Jordan City Park
resources.description: All-ages community park with playground, pond, walking trails, and picnic areas.
reviews: Beautiful park with a pond and big playground.
Always clean, and the kids love coming here.
Awesome walking trails and plenty of parking.

resources.name: Crestwood Park
resources.description: Peaceful, smaller park with splash pad, mature trees, and a shallow creek.
reviews: Splash pad is great and rarely crowded.
Nice creek for exploration.
Shady, peaceful, and good for little ones.

resources.name: Wildflower Park
resources.description: Large grassy park with new playground, wildflower areas, walking trails, and benches.
reviews: Fun equipment and open field, plus wildflowers in spring.
We walk here daily, very family friendly.
Quiet and well maintained.

resources.name: Willow Pond Park
resources.description: Large pond for fishing, ducks, shaded playground, pavilion for gatherings.
reviews: Nice pond for fishing, lots of ducks.
Good shady playground—my kids had a blast.
The pond is nice and there are areas to picnic.
